questions.prompt: What is the v-i characteristic of an open circuit on the v-i plane?
options: C) A line through the origin with slope G
D) A single point at the origin
questions.explanation: An open circuit has i = 0 for all v. On the v-i plane (v horizontal, i vertical), every point with i = 0 lies on the v-axis.

questions.prompt: What is the resistance of a short circuit?
questions.explanation: A short circuit has v = 0 for all i, so R = v/i = 0/i = 0 for any nonzero current.

questions.prompt: What is the conductance of an open circuit?
questions.explanation: An open circuit has i = 0 for all v, so G = i/v = 0/v = 0 for any nonzero voltage.

questions.prompt: Which quantity is the dual of resistance R?
questions.explanation: Under the duality principle, R and G are dual quantities. Swapping R with G (and v with i, series with parallel) gives the dual circuit.

questions.prompt: The dual of a series connection is:
questions.explanation: Under duality, series and parallel are dual topologies. Every series connection in the original circuit becomes a parallel connection in the dual circuit.

questions.prompt: How much power does an ideal short circuit absorb?
options: B) It depends on the current
D) It depends on the circuit
questions.explanation: For a short circuit, v = 0, so p = v * i = 0 * i = 0 regardless of the current. No power is absorbed.

questions.prompt: On the v-i plane, reflecting the v-axis about the line i = v gives:
questions.explanation: Reflecting the v-axis (the open circuit characteristic) about the 45-degree line i = v swaps the roles of v and i, producing the i-axis (the short circuit characteristic).

questions.prompt: The voltage divider gives v_out = v_in * R2/(R1 + R2). Using duality, what is the current divider formula?
questions.explanation: Applying duality: replace v with i, and R with G. The voltage divider v_out = v_in * R2/(R1+R2) becomes i_out = i_in * G2/(G1+G2).

questions.prompt: Which statement about duality is FALSE?
options: A) The dual of KVL is KCL
B) Duality applies to any circuit, planar or non-planar
C) The dual of an open circuit is a short circuit
D) Duality swaps v and i simultaneously
questions.correctAnswer: B) Duality applies to any circuit, planar or non-planar
questions.explanation: The simple duality construction requires the circuit to be planar (drawable on a flat surface without crossing wires). It does not extend to non-planar circuits in its standard form.

questions.prompt: A linear resistor has conductance G = 0.05 S. Its dual element has conductance:
options: D) The dual element has resistance 0.05 ohm
questions.explanation: Under duality, G and R swap roles. A resistor with conductance G has a dual with resistance G (numerically). So the dual has R = 0.05 ohm, which means G_dual = 1/0.05 = 20 S.
